The yogurt itself was richer, creamier, and denser than is my personal preference. It's great if you like a really decadent, heavy kind of frozen treat, but I found myself pretty full after eating less than half. 

At $4.50, it's an expected price point for a specialty dessert like this, but I guess I was hoping for something more unique and distinctive. I took a look at their website and I noticed that there are lots of really cool sounding flavor combos that weren't available at this location. I would have been all about that rose jam with popping grape cotton candy! I don't even know what that is but it sounds so fun! This location had more of the basic options, like an affogatto or boba flavor. 

That being said, it would be great to share one of these to get a little sweet taste treat. Though it's not anything I haven't tried before, it's still a super cute little space, really nice service, and I'm all for embracing any Asian dessert import!
author: Christina P.

description:
Pretty good but definitely nothing special in terms of taste.

First of all--it's soft serve. Sure it comes with some fancy toppings to make it Instagram friendly but at the core of this business is $5 soft.serve.

I got the popcorn and it was a nice afternoon snack and photographed beautifully BUT the actual soft serve doesn't taste like anything. As a vehicle it's great because it's actually the absence of flavor. I kept trying to pick up notes of vanilla or tart or SOMETHING but seriously, takes like cold air...maybe cold nonfat milk? 

Service was kind and the store is minimally decorated, one long bench for seating, clean, etc. I think the "hand crafted" part of their tag line means that they put the toppings on by hand since this tastes like run of the mill commercial soft serve mix. 

Won't seek this out again since there are other ice cream and soft serve places on that part of Irving that offer more value. Fine to try once but won't blow you away.
author: Semuteh F.

description:
THERE'S ALWAYS ROOM FOR DESSERT! No matter how much you had to eat and alcohol to drink.

After finishing from carbon we ventured off to try this lovely place. Menu is really simple. It's soft serve with honey and different toppings. Options are in a cup or cone. Perfect way to end the night with full tummies and great company. If you have a salty sweet palette I recommend you get salted caramel popcorn. It's fckn amazeballs! This place caters to all ages. Place is a bit small so it can get crowded real fast. Once you get your soft serve go hang out in the front and people watch and have great conversations.
author: Mary Ann B.

description:
Meh. This is your fancied up McDonald sundae. You will remember this place because it's different than other ice cream shops, but not because of how delicious the desserts were 

My friend and I shared the honeycomb sundae ($4.75). Here are my thoughts: 

PROS: 
- Yay it's a new way to indulge sugaaaaarrrrr
- Pretty to look at since it's served in a clear, plastic cup 
- Ice cream is not too sweet, and the drizzled on honey adds on an extra kick of flavor and scent

CONS:
- THEY DON'T FILL UP THE ENTIRE CUP. The ice cream was swirled around the center of the cup, leaving the center of the cup empty
- Pretty average ice cream. Ice cream itself was kind of flavorless so all of the flavors came from the add-on items. You are basically tasting the syrup
- No seating so you just grab and go
- You can't try the flavors before buying 

I think most people come here because they want to say they've been here, not to really enjoy the dessert. It's a fun way to eat ice cream but I think I like the $1 sundae at McDonald just as much. Haven't had too much luck finding a good ice cream shop in the Inner Sunset yet. Just a little disappointed.
author: Wendy F.

description:
I was skeptical another ice cream/froyo like place could survive in Inner Sunset, but Honey Creme is fast becoming one of my favorite post-dinner dessert places!

Their soft serve is not sweet and not too milky or creamy (I recommend Easy Breezy's custard if you want a thick and decadent frozen treat) but there is something about this type of texture and taste that I can't help embracing. I think it's an Asian thing (not surprising, Honey Creme appears to be a Taiwanese/Korean mini ice cream chain!). 

I've tried the regular honey, the honeycomb, and the mixed grains. I really love honey and the two honeycombs that come with the honeycomb are enough for the amount of soft serve you get, but I don't think the honeycomb (the regular honey, even less so) is worth the price (despite how Instagrammable it is). You're better off buying an original and putting on some honey or fruit you may have at home. 

My favorite flavor by far is the mixed grains. A drizzle of caramel is a lot sweeter than honey and it does a better job complementing the mellow soft serve. The flavor and scent of their "grains" reminds me of kinako (roasted soy powder, like the kind you find in warabi mochi). Like I said, this sort of dessert appeals to Asian sensibilities.

The price could be more Asian ($5 for a small soft serve is a bit hard to swallow) but at least they have a loyalty card program!
author: Tiffany H.

description:
Final thoughts: Creamy but lacking in the taste department.

Came here with my cousins after dinner. We shared 3: Honey comb, Honey, and Affogato. Just the soft serve itself has no taste. Honey comb was very sweet and waxy tasting (2/5stars). The honey with plain soft had a hint of sweetness (4/5 stars) and the Affogato was not sweet at all with a shot of coffee. It also melted fairly quickly, so I had a milky coffee after a couple of mins.(3/5 stars) Servers were nice and very welcoming!
author: Tiffany C.

description:
I haven't been to the spots down in SoCal so I can't compare it to those, but I've been to MilkCow in Fremont and would say that Honey Creme is definitely better! I had the honey soft serve and it was so good that I ate the whole thing in 5 minutes-- I was actually tempted to get seconds! I kind of wish there was more honey in it but I still really enjoyed it. 

While it is a bit of a small portion for $4.50, I can definitely taste the quality so I don't mind paying extra for that. I would say that it's kind of like a McDonalds soft serve but much more elevated LOL. The employees were also really friendly and efficient when I went so that's a plus! I actually wanted to try the cereal milk one as well but they told me that it's coming soon so I'll be back for that. Overall I'd say it's definitely worth a try!
author: Marny N.

description:
For me personally, I thought the affogato was perfect! 
Taste was light and refreshing with a creamy base of (not overly sweet) frozen yogurt, when topped with the hot fresh brewed coffee it held up well, not melting to quickly, adding the rich sweet honeycomb was perfection! I was fully satisfied and happy ; )
Very happy & friendly staff was also appreciated.
author: Laurie C.

description:
Must be the angle, but all the photos of the Honey Creme cups make the serving size seem  huge. When my boyfriend and I ordered our first Honey Creme honey cup, we were surprised to see that it was actually, pretty small. For the price ($4.50), we were hoping to get a large, red Solo cup sized serving of soft serve ice cream. Granted, we are getting a little older and probably shouldn't be eating that much honey infused ice cream, but I'm just not quite convinced that it's worth the price. 

The soft serve was creamy and light, and we are still curious to try the honey comb, so we may just give it another shot.

The location is a bit small with limited bench seating, so I do see it getting crowded on weekend evenings.

CASH ONLY for now.
author: Camille B.

description: This place is super cute, and the ice cream was delicious and organic! Which was interesting that the cotton candy and everything else was organic. It made me slightly less guilty eating it haha.
author: Allix H.

description:
A unique texture and flavor for a soft serve; the fresh honey comb was a nice touch but fair warning it's super sweet so a small bit goes a long way. I will admit, I didn't care for the wax bits that you get from the shell but at least you know its the real deal. 

The selection is limited but varied enough to accommodate most, the nieces and nephew were really excited about the cotton candy, which was made to order

Yes, it is expensive for what you get and isn't something you would get on a regular basis but its a nice splurge
author: Eddie W.

description:
So this is soft serve ice cream that can be topped with honey, coffee, chocolate or cotton candy. I felt like I had a pit in my stomach after just a few bites. They were friendly and kind but we prefer SF Hometown Creamery just around the corner for their made from literal scratch ice cream. 

No one in my family loved this place. We all shared one small original and 5 of us didn't even finish one small cup as we were not that excited about it. Currently looking for a trash can. Great service. Not excited about the product.
author: Nettie A.

description:
I finally tried this place but I was super disappointed . I felt that it was basically vanilla ice cream with honey on top ! The service was quick and easy . 

The soft serve was good but I didn't see any WOW factor to it . Not saying this place is bad but for $5 a cup I think it cans be better or they need to change the price .

For the price I prefer to go to another dessert place , it almost felt like it was a regular McDonald's ice cream with chocolate on top instead it was with honey .
author: Tiffany K.

description: Super cute! Couldn't help but take a picture there is so many things to try I gotta go back. They have flavored teas and so many kinds of ice cream! The honey comb one is pretty sweet and creamy. A very clean minimalist atmosphere.
author: Ashlee K.

description:
Probably closer to 3.5 stars overall - I'm happy to have tried it, but probably wouldn't make a point of coming back.

The desserts are very pretty! I think that's a big part of their appeal. The interior, though small, is cute as well with decor that fits their overall image. Staff were friendly and prompt, and they take credit cards now.

The problem, I guess, is that the soft serve itself was very bland when I went. Texture was on point - thick and creamy - but the parts that didn't have contact with the toppings (honey and mixed grains powder in my case) had zero flavor. This wouldn't be so bad if the topping distribution were better, but basically the whole middle section tasted like creamy nothingness. 

I'm not sure how they would improve the distribution issue, but I did like the flavor of the mixed grain powder mixed in with the soft serve where I could get it. (It tastes a lot like the sesame powder used in some Japanese desserts, if you've tried that. A nice, mild yet nutty flavor I really like.) As it is, though, for the price I'd rather hit up one of their local competitors (Easy Breezy, Holy Gelato, or Hometown Creamery...)
author: Delia Z.

description: I'm a yelp snob, but keep coming back here for the seasonal tea flavored ice cream and also get a rose tea with boba.  They are generous with samples if you are wary of tea ice cream (which I usually prefer over their base flavor).  Honeycomb topper is a must, items come out instagram ready, and staff is friendly and patient.  Downside is there is little space for seating, but I usually walk with my stuff anyways.
author: Dan P.

description: Came here last night after dinner nearby and decided on sharing one order with my friends since we were so full. It was $4-5, but the order we had this time was a small Honey Creme Cereal Milk - yum! The crunchy with the ice cream was a good texture combo with honey randomly throughly the entire thing. The vanilla is pretty good there too since it's the base of everything here. I want to return to try something on a cone someday.
author: Amanda C.

description:
Always seen this place on people's social media and I finally got to try it a few weeks back. I got the affogato, which is espresso in the soft serve. It was a nice blend of flavors. 

We came after lunch, so my suggestion is that if you aren't too hungry and just wanna try it, share with a friend or two. If not, it'll become too much and that would just be a waste to toss it out.

This place is just like Honeymee in LA.
author: Karen Y.

description:
I love honey and soft serve so was excited to try the two combinations together. Came by on a random weekday at 2pm and the shop was empty but had a decent stream of customers come through during the 20 minutes we were there. Apparently the concept originated in Korea but there are also honey creme stores all over Asia. 

The base is milk soft serve but they had a variety of different toppings you could add ranging from honey, honey comb, espresso poured over the top to a cotton candy topping. There's only one size and is actually a bit smaller than what I'd expected from the pictures. We had the honey drizzle topping which was quite good with the milk soft serve. The soft serve wasn't sweet at all so the honey was a good complement. I don't like my desserts very sweet so this was just the right amount for me. Though the honey really is just a thin drizzle so it may come off bland to those who have a bigger sweet tooth. They also give a punch card if you plan on coming back frequently.
author: Queena T.

description:
Honestly, considering there are two extremely delicious ice cream places literally a street away, they have nothing worth going for.

First of all, they charge $4.50 for a small cup that's much like a child's cup of apple juice. Extremely tiny.

Second, the photos are misleading. It looks like a small cup from Starbucks with all the makings of a frap, but that's not at all what you're getting 

They have two flavors of this soft serve. It's called vanilla and matcha. 

But it's ACTUALLY Plain and Slightly Bitter Green Tea. 

They add some chocolate syrup to the cup and then some chocolate drizzle on top. 

And it looks good, except it's just plain yogurt with chocolate syrup and they charge you $4.50!

Do yourself a favor and go to The Creamery. Or better yet, go to Holy Gelato! That is amazing. 

This place is just not worth it. So sad.
author: Carmen C.

description:
Overall: So you always see pics on facebook/ instagram of your friends who visited certain places or restaurants.  This is definitely one too.  Join your friends and the crowd.  Try out Honey Creme serves soft-serve ice cream.  

Ice Cream: The ice cream was unique, however there's just one flavor - vanilla.  You add toppings to customize it to your taste buds.  Portions are quite small, but small was good bc it was a tad too sweet for me.  

Price: Ranges $4-$5.  They do accept plastic and offers you a stamp card.
author: Stephanie Y.

description:
I scream, you scream, we all scream for honey creme! Honey Creme is very similar to Milkcow in Fremont and I'm just happy to see Korean/Taiwanese desserts making their way across the ocean. I really enjoy their soft serve ice cream because it's not super sweet. It's like eating milk in a ice cream format. Very creamy! 

I got the original because I didn't want anything sugary that night but I did try my friend's dark chocolate version. Not a whole lot of chocolate and I don't find it worth the extra bump in cost.   You can get your ice cream in either cup or cone and for the cups, they give these colorful plastic flat spoons. The cup is small and it's about the size of a tall Starbucks cup. 

I think they offer stamp cards because they stamped my receipt and told me to bring that in next time I come. The space is really small and there's no tables to sit at. They have a bench to sit on in front of the window but this place is more of a grab and go.
author: Diana C.

description:
Hhhmmmm.... 
Taste is just right. Not too sweet. I tried the honey. 
I would come back and try a different flavor. A bit pricey tho.
author: Dianne Jay S.

description:
I've had this place bookmarked since it opened, today I finally managed to go.  All the choices they offer seem pretty fun and creative, even though everything looked great the affogato really caught my eye.  I know the most popular soft serve is the honey topping one and I will make sure I try it next time.

The concept itself is pretty simple, it's a soft serve and topping that they add on.  The affogato was made right in front of me, I didn't know how it would turn out with a soft serve and I must say it was pretty good. My only complaint is that for $4.50 the portions are pretty small, usually soft serve is relatively cheaper than ice cream.

I'm probably going to come back to try the honey topping, even though in my opinion it's overpriced.
author: Josh Giosue D.

description:
Fast service, very simple menu to choose from!!! No tables set up but a bench to sit. The portion is very small for the price which is $4.50 a cup but the flavor is on point! It's not too sweet and very smooth. 

We ordered the honey & affogato. Honey was a very good addition to the soft serve, the honey wasn't too overbearing. The affogato was good too, it tastes like coffee soft serve. 

Overall, pretty good experience and I will be coming back to try the 'coming soon' flavor Cereal & Milk !!!
author: Vanessa Z.

description:
Honey Creme is one of those places that everyone should try once (mostly for the IG/snapchat) but I wouldn't go out of my way to get it. The concept is simple: a vanilla soft serve with your choice of toppings. I had the affogato, which had a shot of espresso poured in, while my friend had the honey. I liked how the flavor of the coffee mixed with the light sweetness of the soft serve, but it might be a little too bitter if you're sensitive to that. On the other hand, the honey was a lot sweeter than the soft serve but they balanced out nicely. However, I would recommend not getting both honey and honeycomb as that would end up being really sweet - diabetes is not worth the picture LOL.

Another con is that this is pretty pricey at $4.50 a cup. You're paying more for the picture and not the actual dessert, but at least their tile wall makes a nice background. Parking in this area is horrendous of course but this is SF, so what do you expect? This is a simple dessert concept but there's definitely room for improvement.
author: KC W.

description: I have joined a hive mind by the lure of this crème of the crop of soft serve. Instead of a cherry on top of your ice cream, Honey Crème replaced that with a honey comb. Trust me, it's the bee's knees. If nature's natural nectar is bee-neath you, there are other drizzles, cotton candy, and caramel popcorn that will to sting your sweet tooth. This original South Korean ice cream parlor is bright, clean, and inviting to their swarm customers.
author: Alexander W.

description:
The soft serve hype is starting to take over and now there's finally one that has opened in the sunset, making it very easy to satisfy my sweet tooth cravings since I lived close by. Came here two Friday's ago while on route to the Giants game. I thought it would be crowded because it was a Friday night and the kiddies just got out from school. Nope! Walked in and there were two people in front of us still deciding so we ordered ahead of them since we knew what we wanted. 

We got one dark chocolate to share. Since I haven't been to HoneyMee in SoCal or Milkcow in Fremont, I don't have much to compare it to. The texture was there in terms of creaminess but at the same time, it wasn't very sweet. There's also a gaping hole in the middle of the cup. The chocolate sauce helped to give the soft serve some sweetness so that helped. 

Paid about 5 dollars for a small serving of soft serve that lacked a little in flavor. Also read on Yelp that they took card but when I was there, they said it was not yet operational. Won't go out of my way to come here again as parking is difficult. But if I'm passing by, yea I'll make a stop by here if the cravings are strong.
author: Cynthia T.

description:
Cute little place for soft serve/ice cream. This site is clean and welcoming. They also have a very cool tower of cones in a vase. I really want to touch it. 

I had the Honey Comb, the entire time i was searching for the flavor because the milk flavor is so light is hard to distinguish. Overall, I don't get the hype...

If there are many guests, I can anticipate a long wait since there's only one person who makes the order.
author: Jess W.

description: What a concept fresh honey comb on top of ice cream , it's a great combination of flavor and beautiful. Great treat
author: P C.

description:
Very cute and some what similar to Honey Mee in socal but not quite as good owing to the soft serve lacking flavor. I had read the reviews before coming and thought people were just not used to a more plain soft serve with honey accenting it as I'd had Honey Mee multiple times in socal. 

...But the reviews were right, the soft serve is simply lacking in flavor and sweetness, it was almost like a soft cold filler material than a treat, the honey does help but it was closer to just eating honey. Or honey over a less flavorful cold whipped cream. Perhaps a good way to illustrate is that I would never order the plain soft serve without anything else here, where as at HM i might be persuaded to eat the soft serve alone. 

That being said, if i was in the area I wouldn't mind coming here again, but I wouldn't make it a point to visit or insist any one else come try it. If you are craving HM, this won't satisfy. One of the few times where the imitator surpasses the original.
author: Susan L.

description:
After seeing pictures of Honeymee in LA, I was hoping this food fad would make it to SF. 

Was pretty disappointed. The ratio of honeycomb to soft serve just doesn't make sense. Guess it would be ok if the ice cream had more flavor...but it does not. The honeycomb is pretty delicious. 2 stars for that. Negative 3 stars for everything else. 

More honeycomb pls...and I will be happy!
author: Emily Y.

description: Looking to have dessert after Easter lunch, we happened upon this place. Pleasant store, with friendly service. I had the Affogato and it was delicious. My sister had the affogato with cotton candy topping. We definitely recommend this place.
author: Robbie H.

description:
This place is fire! I got mine with the honey drizzle on it and it was delicious :) I ate every bite and will for sure be back.
Everyone working there was really friendly too!

Overall great experience, although it is a little pricey for the amount they give. Still 5 stars :)
author: Hayley D.

description: This is a review for Honey Creme's boba. We had the honey tea with honey boba not knowing what to expect. Honey Creme's marketing focuses solely on their soft serve not their boba drinks. Their honey boba drink was delicious! The honey tea had perfect sweetness. They placed the perfect amount of ice and the boba had good sweetness, chewy and delightful. Some boba places don't sweeten their boba enough so it can feel like you're just chewing texture. Honey Creme's boba is just perfect!
author: Caroline N.

description:
It was 52 degrees out but I really wanted to try this place. I passed people who held the Honeycreme cup and I thought dang that's a pretty tiny cup but I can't judge it by its cover.

Ordered the soft serve with mixed grains, and it reminded me of snacks from Hong Kong. The mixed grains included things like peanut and sesame in powder form. The soft serve itself was very fresh and 100x more quality than McDonald's soft serve. You can taste the difference for sure.

Surprisingly I didn't even finish my cup, I was full 3/4 of the way so I ended up throwing the rest away. I didn't want to waste it but they definitely packed a lot of soft serve into the cup. A little on the pricier side but definitely will stop by again if I'm in the area.
author: Julian Y.

description:
I had been dying to try this place for so long, but my experience was very underwhelming to say the least. I love honey and got the honey drizzle soft serve, but I could not justify paying $5-$6 for the small cup. The ice cream was plain vanilla and very mediocre, and the honey was standard as well. Not that I expected anything above and beyond, but I felt like I could easily make this on my own for less than a dollar. Also, the location is rather small and besides the window ledge, there isn't really any seating.

However, I recently tried the yogurt + honey from Souvla which is similar and I'm a big fan.  For some reason, the tart-y flavor that comes with yogurt tastes like a better combo to me than honey + ice cream.
author: Alice S.

description:
It was decent soft serve (think higher grade McDonald's soft

-I got the affagato and yes it's just soft serve with a shot of coffee.

-A little pricey for the size
author: Kimberly C.

description: I really liked the ice cream I got at this place. I got the cotton candy topped on their classic ice cream with coffee put on top. I really liked the flavor the coffee brought out. I  recommend people trying that. Plus it is really cool to see the cotton candy melt away (look at the photos and video I posted). I think that just the plain cream ice cream alone, doesn't have much flavor, but if you top it with something it will be a lot better. Their matcha ice cream was pretty good too, the flavor was strong in that. So for all the matcha lovers, check that out!
author: I K.

description: This place is really good on a sunny day in San Francisco! I like the concept of having one or two flavors of soft serve with different toppings to choose from; it makes things more simple. They also have boba here which is pretty good, too! My only complaint is that the shop is small but it really isn't supposed to be a place where you hang out, which is cool! Good ice cream and really yummy honey comb.
author: Dom B.

description:
My buddy put me on to this place recently. My usual stomping grounds are in Richmond and Inner Richmond when I am around. I always knew Sunset had some very good spots but I am sometimes a creature of habit. 

The shop itself is not very big but realistically your orders are meant to be taken to go anyway. There are a plethora of flavors to choose from regarding soft serve ice cream. 

My buddy ended up getting a new flavor that arrived which is the cereal milk. I had tried something very similar at Momofuku milk bar so I decided on a tasty chocolate based flavor. 

The employees there are super nice and polite. They are very patient while you peruse the menu offerings (I used the word plethora before for a reason) and sometimes makes suggestions. 

Near the entrance there is a very impressive construction of cones. I did take a photo but due to some people stealing photos on here I unfortunately will not be posting it. 

Warning. This place can be very addicting if you live near the storefront. But you will walk away with some soft serve happiness each and every time.
author: Gregory C.

description: This place reminds me of Milkcow in Fremont. It's a little less milky tasting here than at Milkcow but still a good swirl of soft serve. There are a lot more options here. They have colorful cones that come with some type of melt guard to catch the dripping ice cream or toppings. I had the chocolate ice cream which reminded me of those chocolate dipped ice cream cones because the chocolate they put on top hardens. My boyfriend got the affogato. It was pretty good for being espresso that they make from those k-cup like pods.
author: Nicole S.

description:
161129 My favorite ice cream place! My favorite would be the Dark Chocolate or Affogato :)

*Note* these two are semi-sweet, so if you looking for sweet , try their Honey Comb or Cotton Candy.

The Affogato is the original soft served ice cream with a shot of espresso floated on top. This is definitely a good choice for coffee lovers. It's super creamy!!! *Sweet level : 1/5* I love that it's not too sweet, the taste of espresso with lightly sweetened ice cream is perfecto! 

The Dark Chocolate is the original ice cream with Dark Chocolate around the cup & on top. The Chocolate hardens in a thin layer, which is super cool. This was just too delicious, *Sweet Level : 3/5* 

They also use organic milk for their ice cream !
author: Tiffany F.

description: This place is really good, I don't know what the bad reviews are about.. Its super creamy, not too sweet or bland, it's just right. The milk cereal and popcorn ones are good
author: Jason B.

description:
Honey Creme is so good, I will gladly make the trip all the way out there to the Inner Sunset from west Oakland, just to enjoy it.

For those of you who may not be familiar with this, it is Korean style soft serve ice cream that tastes like an ice cold glass of milk, usually served topped with honey, or with a piece of real honeycomb on the side. I recommend the latter; the waxy consistency of the honeycomb might take a little getting used to, but it's well worth it. It's out of this world delicious.
author: Eric L.

description:
Honey Creme is basically soft serve ice cream (vanilla only) that comes out of a taylor ice cream machine. various add-ons (honey comb +1), cotton candy, drizzles extra.

licks:  soft serve vanilla (8oz?) 3.75
-smooth, luxurious taste, sweetness level low unlike Frosty's
-many toppings available, small square honeycomb +1.
-comes in cup not cone, with spoon..

drips:
-only young females present buying honey creme, just an afterthought
-service quick by single server.
-value is in the eye of the beholder. either u like and pay or no like, no pay, value, i.e. kouign amann, cronuts, krispy kreme, et al...
author: Victor G.

description: I'm surprise to like it more than I anticipated. Not too sweet and not too tart. I got their most popular which is the **HONEY COMB". They use organic milk and surprisingly not too heavy, more like a sweet milk. Was very refreshing. The honey comb which I like better than the regular honey. You can use the cube of honey per your liking, instead of having regular honey drizzle all over. I enjoyed my cup but I think it was a lot, I do recommend sharing one. Service was friendly and I got my order almost right after I paid. That's fast service for you.
author: Sandy B.

description:
We decided to try this place and stopped in for an afternoon ice cream treat.  A clean well maintained store, their menu was posted on wall behind the counter. With my terrible eyesight, I was relieved to find a handheld menu on the counter :). 

The organic ice cream, sweetened by honey, appeared to be the main flavor, options enhanced with different toppings such as caramel corn, cotton candy, honeycomb, dark salt chocolate, espresso, and chocolate bean.  There was another flavor called Organic Mixed Grains which appeared to be it's own unique flavor--very interesting, for ice cream.  May try that next time. On average, cost for a small cup will cost around $4.50 each.  

We ordered the Affogato (ice cream with espresso) and the Himalayan Dark Salt Chocolate (ice cream drizzled with dark chocolate with salt), each in cups (cones were another option). The ice cream was not very sweet at all, as you would expect ice cream to be, but more rich and creamy--even the espresso and the dark salt chocolate toppings on each were not terribly sweet.  The taste was quite unexpected but refreshing and enjoyable!
author: Terry W.

description:
// 3.5 stars overall //

Dear Honey (Creme),

Oh how I've missed you for so long. 

Yes, Milkcow (in Fremont) will always be credited for introducing the idea of Korean milk ("plain") soft-serve ice cream  to me. Milkcow, you have been good to me though you've just gotten to the point that your soft-serve is too sweet and is just a constant cycle of the same flavor profile over and over again. 

Despite the fact that you, Honey Creme, offer the same varieties of toppings such as the infamous honey-drizzle, classic chocolate sauce, fluffy cotton candy, and honeycomb, you have added handheld alternatives such as cones (with a tray for less mess) and my new favorite; the affogato (espresso poured on top), which is unique and works well as a combination. So kudos to you.

Affogato // $4.50 // 4 stars - Say what?! Did I just pay almost $5 for unflavored ice cream that is essentially the high-end version of McD's with some extra coffee as an added bonus? Honey Creme seems to think so by throwing in white walls to make it more Instagrammable, by making their soft-serve aesthetically pleasing, and by boasting about higher quality ingredients (at least they use a name brand [Horizon milk] // organic). Well, that is Honey Creme's philosophy. 

After thinking straight about the whole experience, I think it's fair for what they give. For one, it wasn't cloyingly sweet as a result of the ice cream being more milky and plain tasting though was still plenty sweet especially loaded with extra toppings. The consistency was a lot nicer since it was thicker and creamier. Also, the portion sizes though manageable were quite generous especially since it was thicker than normal. On a side note, if you order it with a cone, you pay almost a dollar more but you essentially get more ice cream along with a cone and a nicer looking dessert (perfectly swirled + contrasting dark cone + golden yellow tray for color).

The overall aesthetic that Honey Creme aims for is simplicity. The place itself is small with an open kitchen, its lone communal bench, white and yellow glossy brick wall panel, and colorful bouquet of stacked cones for display. The employees were polite, patient, and very efficient in completing our order.

My only complaint that really involves all stores of this type are that they should offer multiple flavors though that defeats the concept of Korean soft-serve. Generally speaking for Asian-style soft serve ice cream, I've only found Momofoku Milk Bar in New York, Matcha Love in the Mitsuwa Marketplace in San Jose and Cha Cha in Hong Kong to offer other flavors such as Green Tea and Black Sesame.
author: Jacquie H.

description: Was excited to try this place out but wasn't that impressed the yogurt itself was kind of bland. The honey comb was a nice touch but as you eat it you end up with pieces of wax and it's sort of weird because I had to spit out the wax as I kept eating the yogurt.
author: Tiffany L.

description:
Anyone can easily split a cup to satisfy that sweet tooth. Breaks down to about $2.50 for 2 people so I like that! I recommend only getting the honey with the ice cream because the other combinations look very overwhelming, but that's just me!

I'm borderline 3 stars because of the lack of seating and the cashier sitting down on her phone since nobody was in line. BUT giving Honey Creme 4 stars for ease of ordering, modern vibes, and an awesome pic for all you Snapchat addicts!
author: Brandon M.

description:
I was thrilled they opened something similar to milk cow in Fremont!  The use of soft serve with a drizzle of honey is the new thing. not too sweet, but the perfect amount.

but why only 3 stars? this soft serve did not resemble anything to milk cow In Fremont and just tasted like soft serve from McDonald's.... not saying McDonald's is bad, but the price tag for this honey and soft serve was $4+ and I was not thrilled at all.  skip the honey comb unless you are trying to do it for the gram. the difference from milk cow was the advertisement of the organic whole milk they use, I'm not so sure what milk they use here..

this $4-5 will help you with 100 likes on Instagram, but not so sure about the taste of it. hyped up, I will leave my taste buds and cravings to milk cow in Fremont. also, in my cup, there was a big whole in the middle, where the soft serve was supposed to be. uhhh, fill me up next time please!
author: Josie L.

description:
Many of my friends having been posting pics of this place on Snapchat and Instagram, so I thought I should give them a try. 

The place is nice and cute, but $4.50 for a small plain vanilla soft serve is not worth it. I found their soft serve to be thicker than most yet a little bland. Now the toppings are pre-selected, and they don't offer much of a variety. I got the mixed grains with honey, which I thought would have been granola, but instead tasted like crushed graham crackers. My friends got the dark chocolate which was good when you mixed it in with the soft serve and the honey comb which was good but had a weird after taste. 

This place has the potential to be a nice dessert spot, but they definitely need to expand their soft serve selection and provide more toppings if they want to compete with the other dessert shops on Irving.
author: Denzell S.

description:
first Honey Creme in the US. people stop comparing it to Honey Mee. Honey Creme is the original ice cream chain found in Taiwan, Korea, Singapore, and Philippines. Honey Mee is a copy of Honey Creme. 

cash only at the moment. it is too hot in there. I suggests they get some AC going because the moment they hand the ice cream to you, it starts to drip. Only a bench seating. one person handles the money and order, one person pumps the ice cream and one person does the toppings. they need a better system because the orders get backed up and people are waiting for their orders and the small shop gets crowded fast. 

I got the honeycomb. be aware that you will be eating the natural wax of the honeycomb. that wasn't pleasant. I was disappointed how hollow the ice cream was. for the price and the hollow core ice cream, it was a ripped off. ice cream is not too much. only comes in one flavor and can do different topping.
author: Jules L.

description: Sorry to kill the buzz.. Ok couldn't resist the pun. But seriously, it was just okay. Us three amigos wandered over after a filling dinner and decided to pop in. I had the original soft serve with Honeycomb for $4.75. The soft serve is great texturally but has too subtle a flavor. The honeycomb was good but the square was a little small for the comb:ice cream. The serving size was adequate if you are already full. Makes for a cute photo but I'd probably go elsewhere for ice cream.
author: Angela L.

description: A new Boba and soft serve shop in town. Organic soft serve in a colorful cone! Boba and sundaes too. Boba was fresh and the honey tea clean and refreshing. Nothing artificial about any of the tastes. Friendly quick service.
author: kirstenbb c.

description: They specialize with their ice creams and it was not a disappointment. I love how they have stamp cards too. I just wish their drinks could be better.
author: Casey Y.

description:
This place reminds me of Honeymee in LA (http://www.yelp.com/biz/honeymee-los-angeles-2?hrid=JZRANlAOlJVVMmG1aZ6adA&utm_campaign=www_review_share_popup&utm_medium=copy_link&utm_source=(direct))) which I wasn't impressed with. 

Honey Creme is expensive ($5) and flavorless which forces you to add toppings. I got the one with the honey and it tasted like straight cream and honey. Don't let the pictures deceive you, it looks better than it tastes.
author: Cindy A.

description:
After hearing the hype about this place, I had to come by and check it out. Came in around 9:30pm on a Monday and there was no wait. As a coffee lover, I went ahead and ordered the Affrogato. 

At first bite, it was already a miss. There was no flavor to the soft serve. You pretty much need to add some sort of flavor since it is completely bland.

Yes, it is something Instagram worthy but it's definitely not a memorable experience that would make me want to go back for more. You're honestly better off ordering a McDonald's $1 cone.
author: Kristine C.

description:
Best soft serve / vanilla ice-cream I've ever had. Most ice-cream is too sweet for me because I feel that they use a lot of sugar and it masks the delicate flavors of anything else. 

I'm lactose intolerant, but was able to process this ice-cream better than anything else--maybe because it's made with organic milk. 

I love the flavor of organic milk and cream, and the flavors of those things really stand out at this joint.

I wish they made layers of ice-cream and honey--instead of only drizzling it only on top--so that it is better distributed throughout the dessert. I'll ask them next time...
author: jolie L.

description: This place is bad. The consistency of the soft serve is nasty and the photos in the menu don't reflect the ice cream at all. Got tricked by the beautiful green matcha ice cream photo and the real thing was unrecognizable. They don't use the real naturally dark green matcha. And even if they do, they dilute the shit out of it with whip cream-like ingredient. And if you can imagine that, that's what my ice cream looked like. Looked pale and tasted gross. Ate two bites and threw it away.
author: Momoe K.

description: My first time tried this Taiwanese franchised ice-cream in Hong Kong. I am happy to see them again in San Francisco. The soft ice-cream is very smooth and not too sweet. I had the regular and the Milk Tea flavour ice cream and both were good. However, the location is difficult for parking. $4.50 - $5.00 for a small cup of ice- cream is a bit pricey but I don't think Mc Donald ice-cream sundae taste anything close to this at all even though they are both soft ice cream.
author: Katherine L.

description: Got the honey comb ice cream! It's prefect. Ice cream is not too sweet so it's prefect with the honey!
author: Maple L.

description: Seriously addicting. I'm so happy I found this place! So many flavors to choose from but I decided to get the honeycomb. The organic milk ice cream is not that sweet at all which is why I really liked it. You can scrape the honeycomb with your tiny spoon so you have control of how much you want per scoop. I am definitively coming back to try the cotton candy and affogato
author: Gwen M.

description:
If you want decorated soft serve come here!

Thought this would be some dense creamy goodness but it's very similar to soft serve in texture.  The signs do say "soft ice cream" though.

I tried the one with coffee beans, was not impressed.  I'd much rather indulge in traditional ice cream.  They are super photogenic little cups of dessert though, I'll give them that.
author: Christina L.

description:
Can live without it

Not memorable

service was nice, cute decor, open space

I thought the consistency wasn't smooth or creamy enough. Didn't have much flavor? Just a typical ice cream in a cup with toppings

I rather eat $1 ice cream from McDonald's or go to Soulva for Greek yogurt
author: Carol Y.

description: This place is okay, it's basically creamy soft serve with somewhat fancy toppings.  I'll admit that I get the craving for this stuff once in a long while, but it's pricey for what it is.  I got the soft serve with the honeycomb.  It was a pretty pricey dessert.  I ended up getting the scraps of the honeycomb since there wasn't much left in the box.  This was both good and bad I guess as it made it easier to eat, but didn't look so great presentation wise.  I can see where this place might have appeal if you want a nice photo, but it's mostly just looks.  The soft serve itself is nice and creamy, but I don't think it's exceptional.
author: Bryson L.

description:
New ice cream joint opened so my family and I decided to give it a try. With so many ice cream shops around the area, their specialty is the fact that they use organic milk for their soft serve. Decided to get their original with the honey to see if it's truly organic.

Especially coming from trying Honey Mee in LA just a week ago, perfect time to make a comparison! Honey Creme's soft serve does truly taste organic, the flavor is very light. I could understand why some of the reviews would say it's bland. I liked the light profile because it allows the honey to come through. I prefer my dessert not overly sweet so the soft serve with the honey made a good balance. Their honey is a little bit on the sweet side so I would imagine it'll be sugar overload if the soft serve was packed with sugar which I'm glad it didn't.

Super cute shop, glad the line wasn't too long so we got served really quickly. In and out in about 10 minutes. Compare to Honey Mee, I prefer HC's soft serve, HM's honey. Would definitely come back to try the other flavors!!
author: Elaine Y.

description:
hype. People spend more time trying to take the perfect Instagram pic than enjoying it. With that being said, here's my review

organic/glorified McDonalds cone for 5$.  Make sure to order with topping or else you'll be tasting absolutely nothing. 

I ordered one with the honeycomb. I enjoyed it, but a lot won't.  Such concentrated sweetness in the tiny square for some. 

Will I come back? maybe
author: Angelica C.

description:
For "specialty" soft serve ice cream, I thought Honey Creme was just okay for the price you pay. I will say that they give you a pretty large amount and the ice cream itself is tasty, but I didn't really detect anything special about it? It's a pretty small space with window seats aka a ledge you can sit on, not actual chairs or stools. They make each order pretty quickly, and I liked the popcorn topping my friend got! I chose the cotton candy topping mostly for the Instagram pic, but it really wasn't worth it and was kind of hard to eat if you actually wanted a spoonful of cotton candy AND ice cream.

I do like the idea of real honeycombs added on, so I would go back with a friend to just try that. Overall, save your money for the specialty ice cream shops all over San Francisco unless you're in the Sunset and really, really craving some soft serve!
author: Grace C.

description: I tried Honey Creme last week with my friend and it was A-ok. They have very limited menu and the boba took 15 minutes to prepare which kind of suck because my friend finished his ice cream by the time my boba came out. I just got the peach tea with honey boba. Simple, nothing special. My friend had the ice cream and he said it was just regular ice cream with chocolate on top. Nothing special.
author: Monica W.

description:
Great customer service! Tasty soft serve! (I tasted a little coconut flavor dunno why lol) the honey comb is so much tastier than milk cow's at Fremont ( Fremont ones I felt like chewing a plastic towards the end while this one quickly dissolved in mouth!) 

Def a neighborhood gem for ppl living in the city!
author: VIvian Z.

description:
I love me a food adventure!
Hubby and I stopped by after a date night dinner at Social Kitchen.
This place was kind of kitchy and hyped up bc it's trendy, but I enjoyed my treat nonetheless.
I ordered the Dark Chocolate, and my love ordered the Affogato.  Not the biggest fan of dark chocolate to begin with, but the drizzle on mine hardened like old school Magic Shell, and was waxy, just the same.  But I'm an ice cream addict, and that was not enough to deter my enjoyment.  The Affogato on the other hand was DE-LISH.  Perfect blend of flavors, def not too sweet.  Hubby won with this one, and I will def order this next time around. 
Toppinsg just feel a little stingy.  But I guess its really all about the soft serve.  Consistent with other reviews, the soft serve was not very sweet.  But it's not meant to be!  Just heed warning before your visit so you're not expecting something else.  Don't compare or expect the $1 McDonald's cone, bc you will not be happy. It is still enjoyable, trust me!
Also, no hole in either of our cups.  Honey Crème reads your reviews yelpers! :)
Wouldn't mind coming again for the Affogato next time in the area.  Fun to try.  But not a "WILL TRAVEL FOR" kinda dessert for me.
author: Arcie Marie D.

description:
Maybe it's because I'm getting to "THAT AGE", but I thought it was great that the soft-serve at Honey Creme wasn't very sweet. Plus, they use organic milk. It's like a mini victory to me: "Diabetes, I am curbing you for another day!"

I ordered the Honey Comb, and while the serving size did look small, it was more than enough for an afternoon treat. The honeycomb was about a cube inch in size, which was very sweet and complimented the subtle soft-serve. I broke off pieces of the comb as I ate, which reminded me of eating honey with plain yogurt. Refreshing and did not sit heavy in your stomach afterwards.

I'll definitely venture back, but docking off one star mostly because it's a fairly pricey dessert. And at over $5, the cones are even more expensive than the cups!

Notes:

- Place is very clean, staff are nice and friendly! Helpful when I needed to get napkins.

- Line is long, but moves fast, since there's only one flavor of soft-serve and the only difference are the toppings.

- Yes, they do take credit cards! (Square)

- Yes, they have a stamp card! Buy 10 get 1 free.

- Only one window bench, usually filled up with a group of high schoolers. Did I mention I am at "that age"?
author: Vicky F.

description: Yeah, definitely not worth the price for an average tasting soft serve. It tastes bland and it melts quickly. I mean it is cute for pictures but I'd rather buy boba or get Mc Donald's soft serve instead.
author: Linore R.

description: Super friendly service and a nice addition to SF! My sister and I came here on a Saturday afternoon. The parking was horrendous but we eventually found a spot. There was barely a line outside and the inside looked very cute and small. The lady at the counter even showed us the menu and recommended what we should try, since it was our first time at Honey Creme. She recommended the honey comb, chocolate, Afogato, and another one. My sister got the honey comb and I got the caramel popcorn. It was ready in less than 5 minutes. The soft serve looks really small when they hand it to you but it actually isn't. The soft serve was really creamy and not too sweet. The popcorn gave it a crunchy and sweet and savory taste! The honey comb wasn't bad as well. Will definitely come back again!
author: Jeanette Q.

description:
My friend and I stopped by for a treat after a jog. I thought it would be like Milkcow, but I was kind of disappointed. Next time, I'll save my calories for something better.

Rating Breakdown:
1/2 Stars for Taste -- 
I got the original flavor while my friend got the affogato. The texture of the ice cream was creamy, but there was something off about the flavor. You know the difference between diet and regular coke? Or the difference in the empty icing of a supermarket cupcake and the buttercream deliciousness of a real cupcake? The ice cream flavor at Honey Creme just wasn't....rich enough. It definitely fell flat. 

0/1 Stars for Value --
So I paid $3.75 for a cup of mediocre soft serve. My friend paid $4.50 for an extra shot of decaf espresso. To be honest, save your money and get a soft-serve at Costco. It will taste much better for half the price.

1/1 Stars for Customer Service --
The people working were and patient as my friend and I deliberated over the options.  My friend and I were discussing the pros/cons of having caffeine so late in the evening, and the cashier very helpfully pointed out that she could make the shot decaf. Our ice creams were ready very quickly.

No bonus star because I will definitely give this place a hard pass in the future. 

TL;DR: Meh. Pass.
author: Abby W.

description:
This place is adorable! 

It's a little hard to look for parking but it's definitely worth the hassle. The staff is super friendly, greeted my friends and I immediately when I walked in. I got the original honey comb and dark chocolate. Personally I like the dark chocolate more, but the honey comb texture does perfect with the soft serve! Coming back soon! 

Tip: as of 5/5, they're only taking cash for now
author: Tracy V.

description:
Literally paying $4.50 for a small cup of soft serve and chocolate sauce.... Is so not worth it. It's super hyped. It's something to eat one time, and never again.

First of all, even getting the hardening chocolate on top tastes like nothing.. I had to swirl the chocolate to actually get flavor. The flavor of vanilla isn't strong at all, you might as well get jamba juice across the street or even boba.
author: Char C.

description: Cool concept and Interesting flavors. Tad pricy for the size, but the taste was creamy and smooth. We ordered the honey comb and coffee flavor. They legit brew fresh coffee and pour it directly into the yogurt. WHHAT. That was cool. Other than that, I do not think i'll be back just because the taste wasn't too flavorful and was more on the bland side.
author: Mary L.

description:
3.5 stars. The soft serve ice cream is really soft and smooth. Very nice. I liked the honey flavor of the honey comb, but I just didn't like the chewy wax. I'd prefer just straight honey.

There is a bench for sitting inside but no tables. So it's not a comfortable place to hang out for too long.
author: Ali F.

description:
Perfectly whipped soft frozen cream. Barely any ice, dense, smooth texture. Luxurious! Not too sweet too.

They could benefit from adding flavors like black sesame and matcha though. Currently it's just toppings. 

This is the only US location. They have tons throughout Asia and Australia.
author: Alias A.

description: We always saw a long line when we walked by this place but never understood the hype, so when we walked by one day and saw no one in there, we thought it was the perfect time to try. I ordered the honey and added chocolate for a total of $5.  I watched the lady made the froyo, and was surprised by how small the cup was. It also seemed very quick and straightforward to make this, with only a few simple ingredients, so I thought it was quite overpriced. Once I tasted it, I thought it actually tasted quite good- I can taste the fresh milk in the froyo, the dark chocolate tasted gourmet, and the combination with honey was perfect. I enjoyed this dessert and the portion was good. I'll probably come back from time to time, but not as frequently as I would like to given the price (and this is not sit down place).
author: Sarah W.

description:
Wow. I'm surprised about how high the rating is for this place. I LOVE ICE CREAM, and this place was kind of a disappointment. 

I ordered a premium soft ice cream with dark chocolate. I had no idea what I was eating. It was literally flavorless with no cream taste. Usually soft serve has a good vanillay and creamy taste, but I swear there was no taste. Even the chocolate had no taste. It's true when people say this soft serve looks better than it tastes. 

I can't really recommend this to any one, but I know many people would love coming here just to get cute food pics- that seems like a good idea.
author: Wendy T.

description: This place is so cute! I am a huge cotton candy lover so I was beyond excited to try this place out. Even though I came for the cotton candy I stayed for the ice cream! Lol. No but seriously the ice cream was delicious. I personally do not like my ice cream too sweet and their ice cream is perfect. I feel like it's a really good combination with the cotton candy. I can't wait to come back.
author: Priscilla R.

description:
Honey Creme originated in Korea and now has its first U.S. storefront in SF!  Like many of the reviews here, the soft serve is lightly sweet.  However, I didn't notice the strong milk flavor that some people mentioned, but that could be due to the sweetness of the honeycomb.  The employee told me customers were hesitant to try the honeycomb because of the bee's wax making it look inedible; I ate it and liked it: sweet, sticky, nice chew, and melts in your mouth. 

Give them some time & I may return during a warm summer evening.
author: Jessica S.

description:
Awesome soft serve from Asia! Got the honey soft serve which is pretty much a classic staple flavour now. The soft serve wasn't overly sweet, which was definitely a plus. The taste of the milk was quite strong, which I also enjoyed. 

The taste of honey complemented the soft serve quite well. I especially enjoyed scrapping the hardened honey off the side of the cup. 

Would recommend.
author: Yu S.

description: The soft serve is pretty but not much too it. There are tastier cold dessert spots in this area. Do yourself a favor and go to San Francisco's Hometown Creamery across the street instead.
author: Elsie M.

description:
It's the perfect amount per person, so if you're planning to share - Goodluck!

The place is lovely. Something about white walls and pops of color makes me feel giddy inside. Very simplistic and cute. Love it.

The service was great. Very tentative employees! 

The honey isn't too sweet. The honey comb on the other hand was, and I was just not a big fan of the flavor but the guy next to me loved it! 

The soft serve had the perfect texture. Yes, that matters to me.. Some places just don't get it right. I'm just always on a hunt of a place that will serve soft serve like McDonalds do!

Although the soft serve had the perfect texture, it lacked flavor.. Badly. I then realized that it wasn't actually vanilla flavor soft serve but just plain milk soft serve. 

I think if a place is already going to have few selection on flavors (toppings) then the least they can do is make the main keep component, which is the soft serve), taste flavorful.

I wouldn't go out of my way to come back here again. If do think this place is unique and if you're around and craving for some soft serve, then definitely give this place a whirl!
author: K B.

description: Bad ice cream. The service was super bad and they ripped me off with the ice cream they left a hole in the middle. The next day I went to complain and they came up with a lame excuse saying "Oh we did it so you can get the scoop of ice cream with honey." Lamest excuse ever. Also if I could I would give it 0 stars because of the experience. Don't get anything from there ever you'll get ripped off.
author: Adam S.

description:
I almost never give One Star, yet this place rightly deserves it. This place is a corporation out of Taiwan and tied to a "majestic" investment firm.  It is a chain business. This is where a local, community small business should be.  Support the regional economy. and its families.  Not junk like this hole.

Honey Cream does the most intelligent thing possible. Their products, like honey and cream, come from 6,500+ miles across the Pacific Ocean; whereas, Sonoma County is only 45 miles away.  So this must be extra special ice cream? Unless your tongue is numb, and you are a mindless human clone, the soft serve lastes like typical vanilla ice cream with a few molecules of honey.

(Consumers should not permit their selves to be misled and exercise intelligence. Ignore the advertising spin and searches. Research concrete information on where your food comes from.)
author: David S.

description: Delicious, creamy milk flavored soft serve ice cream that can be compared to Honey Mee in LA if you're curious. I like that it's not overly sweet. However I would say price point wise it's fairly expensive especially since if you get ice cream in the cup, there is a hollow center. Hopefully this can be improved.
author: Wendy L.

description: Enjoyed the Cereal Milk flavor. Rich and creamy with a little crunch. Cornflakes mixed with oats drizzled with honey. They fill the cup first with the cereal oat mixture and then added the soft serve over it. Love the cereal crunch at the bottle of cup. The perfect size and not too sweet.
author: M S E.

description:
I've heard a lot about MilkCow in Fremont and the other honey soft serve ice cream joints down in SoCal so I got really excited when Honey Creme opened in the sunset!

It was my first time having honey soft serve, and I liked how it wasnt overly sweet. I had the soft serve with the mixed grains (which was basically powdered peanuts/almonds?) and it was good. I was trying to figure out what flavor the soft serve was, and the friendly employees told us it was milk flavored. Portions were kind of small, but we shouldn't be eating too much dessert anyway right? The employees are super friendly, service was great. I'll have to come back in the future to try the other flavors.

Another note - this place is cash only, but I'm sure they're going to fix that soon.
author: Annie L.

description:
The coffee(espresso) honey cream was SOOOO good.  I've never had anything like it.  The texture and creaminess is what does it for me.  Im a huge fan of coffee anything and this combonation was out of this world.  

The shop is small, clean and quint.  Service was fast and friendly however it was on the expensive side.  

Treat yourself to some Honey Creme!
author: Henry S.

description: The coffee milk tea soft serve was delicious with its subtle flavor, and creamy, smooth texture. For anyone who loves espresso & ice cream as much as me, you definitely need to try the affogato :)
author: Jackie S.

description: I got the matcha green tea and it was terrrrrrrible. Cheap hot pot green tea ice cream is better than this stuff. The first taste you get it like frozen hard milk fat and then you get an awful super bitter matcha. No thanks. I'm sure their original is way better but stay away from the green tea
author: mackenzie e.

description:
We attended the soft grand opening on 4/30. It's a small and cute place. Unfortunately, like others have mentioned -- there's a small bench available for patrons to sit on. Currently, there is only 1 machine and a small area set aside to assemble toppings. 

I truly appreciated the fresh cup of espresso that went with along my affogato. The espresso is brewed to order. (There is a bin full of Nespresso capsules.) I think they use decaffeinated coffee? A lot of the customers ordered their signature soft serve with honey. I wish the portion size was a little bigger for the price. 

The soft serve is not your average soft serve that you would get a McDonald's. It's packed with more milk flavor. I will be back to try the cereal & milk flavor -- hoping it will be on par with Momofuku's cereal milk soft serve!
author: Jay Z.

description:
Honey I'm disappointed! 
I am such a fan of this concept and was so excited to try it since it was in the neighborhood. I've tried a similar one in SoCal, unfortunately that one was much better.

The soft serve was creamy but bland. My friend tried the affogato which was by far the favorite, def recommend trying that! Popcorn one was also good, and the whole honeycomb piece was fun but tasted just alright. Really nothing special here, and the worst part was for a tiny, almost sample size, cup of "nothing special" it was $4.50! Seriously... 
Also staff was friendly, always appreciate that.
author: Fiona D.

description:
I don't like this Honeycreme business. I don't understand the hype. 

I'll take it straight up: Vanilla ice cream with honeycomb. 

The ice cream itself was okay. Soft serve style with no indistinguishable difference than McDonalds. I mean, I guess one could argue that it's a tad creamier but that's just splitting hairs. Their big seller is their honeycomb. Fresh pieces of honeycomb. How else could you get it? No way am I climbing up trees. But, actually, you can get them easily at the Farmer's Market. 

So, was the honeycomb good? Of course. With the ice cream, it definitely was. So what's the big deal then? Can't we just buy a tub of vanilla ice cream from Safeway and a bag of honeycomb from the Marina and call it a day? 

Well, we live in a society where convenience is everything. Thus, essentially how the creation of Honeycreme came to be. It wasn't bad ... but it wasn't out of the world either.  

Come here for your instagram photo. And don't miss the colorful cones :)
author: Fiona L.

description: 3.5 tiny cup of milk-based soft serve at 4.25 with honey drizzle inside cup (or can have the actual honeycomb add on) like those found in LA and Asia. for me, more of a novelty and not a regular go to like a taiyaki soft serve.
author: Rob C.

description: I wanted to try this place today and its great. Love it. Also great service. I wanted to have something as an alternative for honeymee since honeymee is far. Although, I feel like the ice cream here doesnt have honey in it when honeymee did. Its just vanilla ice cream with honey comb.
author: Michelle N.

description:
THE WORST KNOCKOFF Honeymee I've ever had. This placed tried stealing the look and flavors from Honeymee, but they didn't even get anywhere close to the taste of Honeymee. I got Honey and the honey itself seemed like it was honestly from one of those bear bottles from the supermarket. You can honestly get MUCH better honey from any farmers market! The soft serve had no taste to it and the consistency was lacking. The price is totally not worth it and I will not be coming back. Save yourself the $4.50 and wait til you go to Socal to try the real thing. 

P.S. They're also really stingy with the amount of honey they give you, especially compared to how much Honeymee would give you.
author: Cindy P.

description: Waiting for our dinner table we wandered down the street and saw people lined up inside and getting the fancy cotton candy version and it was fascinating. So after dinner we popped back over and shared an affogato. There was absolutely zero flavor to this thing, except for the flavor of the coffee. Truly...just no flavor at all. It didn't need to be sweet...it just needed to have some flavor. Ugh. We got one to share and neither of us wanted it. It went in the trash. That's expensive trash.
author: Laurie H.

description: I love Ice cream with a honeycomb!! I first tried one of these at Honeymee in LA and I was super happy to find that similar stores exist up in Norcal. Aside from this store, there's also milk cow in Fremont that pretty much serves the same thing. I'm not a huge fan of sweets so I think the ice cream with just the honeycomb is enough. They do have a lot of other options where they add honey or chocolate fudge on top of or in lieu of the honeycomb. Personally i think the honeycomb's the best part! :) A+ Now if they'd only open one closer to downtown :P
author: Annie Z.

description:
I think a lot of people don't appreciate Honey Creme for what it is. It's a simple milk soft serve with toppings. In this world of crazy desserts (baked bear... afters... rolled ice cream), this place is a no gimmicks (well maybe that cotton candy topping), simplistic dessert shop. 

If you like Honeymee in SoCal, it's basically the same. And in it's simplicity, it's delicious. 

Yes, it's a bit overpriced, but what in the city isn't? Prices are comparable to Honeymee in SoCal as well.
author: Jeannie L.

description:
Haven't tasted many soft serves but Honey Creme soft serve seemed more fluffy and not overwhelmingly sweet. 
It's apparently hand made and fluffed with organic milk.
Tried the cotton candy, affogato, and caramel popcorn...
My favorite is the cotton candy.

Cotton candy is made out of pure sugar cane and delightfully good!!!

Pay an extra $1 and you'll get it on a fancy cone.
author: Dee R.

description: Surprisingly not sweet which was satisfying. The consistency is so light and creamy. I opted for the chocolate beans which was pretty good, the beans weren't overwhelming - a light caffeinated kick.
author: Briget P.

description:
I had such high hopes for this place but it just wasn't as good as I thought it would be...
I came here one afternoon and decided to get a soft serve with a honey comb. I was pretty disappointed after trying it because it had little to no flavor even with the honey that was in it. It was also almost $5 which was pretty pricey to me but I thought in the beginning that it would be worth it but it ended up not being as good. I might return if there's any improvement but as of now, I don't think I'll be back.
author: Cee H.

description:
I so wanted to love Honey Creme. Ever since I went to Honeymee in Orange County, I've been obsessed with organic true milk ice cream and real organic honey. What's the difference between Honeymee/Honey Creme ice cream and regular ice cream? The "milk ice cream" trend uses quality milk and fewer ingredients for a truer milk taste, so the ice cream tastes thick but still soft, and much less sweet, with no artificial tastes. So far so good, but the Honey Creme ice cream was nowhere as good as Honeymee.

The topping options are creative and fun - you can get the honey or honeycomb, but they also have cotton candy, popcorn, mixed grains, chocolate, or more. I think this is the first and only location in SF that serves true milk ice creams, so it's still worth giving a shot.
author: Kate M.

description: There are so many ice cream option on Irving Street and I am determine to try them all by the end of 2017. Honey Creme is a good addition to the line up. They offer a more unique twist on soft serve ice cream. I ordered the Organic Mixed Grain, which is tasty. The ice cream itself is not very sweet/flavor-neutral, and the consistency is slightly airy. Mixed grain itself has the texture of crushed cheerios and tastes very similar. I would say that the ice cream is lighter in consistency and sweetness compared to frozen yogurt/ice cream/gelato/McDonald's Sundae. If you're craving something sweet, I would not recommend this place. If you want something worthy of posting on social media, then come here. Service was quick and friendly. No inside table seating.
author: Daryll G.

description: Stumbled upon Honey Creme after spending the day at the park, chose a chocolate covered original - and it was perfect! The ice-cream was soft and light, and the chocolate formed a crunchy-sort-of-shell texture. Yum. Going to have to make this place a must anytime I'm nearby...
author: Jodie B.

description:
The soft serve is super thick and creamy and barely sweet. Love it! 

The small cup is a perfect portion size, however, I do take issue with the gap and spaces in the center of the soft serve. You know what I mean. A hollow soft serve ain't cool. 

I usually get honey or cotton candy at these places but I felt inspired to get the whole honey comb. It was fun until I spent most of the evening picking cold, hard wax from my teeth :D
author: Jacquee P.

description:
I don't know why this place has lower reviews.... 
I've never been to honey mee so maybe that's why.

Anyways I ordered the regular honey soft serve. I was tempted with the honey comb but wanted some more even distribution of honey. They were a little heavy on the honey but still tasted great! I shared with my BF and I'm glad we only got one bc it does get pretty sweet after a while. Yah it can be "expensive" but considering how much ice cream they give you, it's not that bad. 

I do have to say, maybe they can play some background music bc when I walked in it was like DEAD quiet. There were a few people eating their desserts but it was eerily quiet. 
With several local honey options, it'd be cool if they let you choose your honey! Just a thought.

Cute little store and worth a try. Share one though!
author: Elaine L.

description: Gave this place a try after dinner, their soft-serve isn't all that. I got the honey comb soft serve and the comb was waxy which made me feel like i should've just got the one with just honey drizzle. The cup is really small compared to the pictures and i would come here only if was in the area craving soft serve, but honestly i would rather get McDonalds soft serve because it pretty much tastes identical to that but pricier.
author: Korina D.

description:
I have to admit the first time I tried honey creme, I didn't like it. I thought the creme was too bland and that there was not enough topping. It grew on me...especially now that I know to ask for more topping (oats are my favorite). 

Still a hassle to eat the honeycomb with the creme though. You have to bite into the honeycomb and it has a very strange waxy texture. Be prepared to realize that the cup itself is pretty small. The pictures really do not do it justice. 

They also have a loyalty card if you plan on going often....or even if you don't plan on going often get one just to hoard haha.
author: Anna H.

description: I heard this place is really popular in Taiwan and that totally makes sense. Their soft serve is legit - creamy and not too sweet. It's so good even without toppings! The price is a little steep at $4 per cup, but it is the perfect amount! I ordered the one with honeycomb and loved it. The honeycomb looks small, but it is super sweet so it was definitely enough to complement the ice cream. My bf got the affogato and loved it too. Didn't get to try one of their colorful cones or other toppings like popcorn, honey, cotton candy, etc., but I plan to next time!
author: Stephanie G.

description:
It's a cute gimmick, I'll give them that. The soft serve can be addicting and the toppings are complimentary but I have to say, take a picture of your food because it's basically included in the price. 4.50 for soft serve isn't really worth it in my opinion. This is definitely one of those places where you come here to add to your Instagram. Besides the price, I will have to say I did enjoy my dessert.

To elaborate on the food, I ordered the soft serve with honeycomb. The soft serve had a nice subtle creme flavor, with no overbearing flavor and basically compliments whatever you add to it. However, I would recommend just ordering the regular honey because you get more honey that is evenly spaced out in the treat. I don't think any of the treats stand out from each other so it is much more of a preference thing. Just pick which ever flavor looks most appealing to you!
author: Jeremy M.

description: Surprisingly disappointing. First day of its USA opening (it's a chain in Asia) and was super pumped to try it out since SF never usually gets 'first opening in USA' of anything and as you all know, I LOVE desserts, especially soft serve. A few things happened: 1) they didn't accept card even though they had a square register 2) the honeycomb fell off after ten seconds (no lie), this is my first and ONLY pic. When I asked for a second honeycomb bc their first one literally tanked after the first pic, no apology AND they squished the soft serve that I couldn't even take another pic  3) I found a hair on my spoon and when I asked for a new one, no apology either, just handed me a new one. Overall, I'll chalk it up to opening day oversights so I'll give it a try in a few weeks again and hopefully it'll be better. The soft serve was also a little bland and the cone didn't taste that great either. Next time, I'll just get a stupid cup so I won't get disappointed.
author: Vanessa K.

description: This is a cute and fun but underwhelming soft serve shop. I am hoping that they expand their menu offerings to spice things up a bit. Come here for a plain vanilla soft serve topped with simple ingredients like honey, honey comb, chocolate chips etc. Prices are a bit expensive relative to the serving size. I thought that the soft serve tasted OK but was not amazing. Service is friendly and the line moves quickly. It was nice that they were offering buy one get one free coupons on their opening day after they ran out of soft serve.
author: Alice H.

description: Waiting for friends to cross the bridge.... stopped by Honey Cream for some milk tea. They use real honey and fresh honey comb. The original milk tea i got is very refreshing
author: A Squared T.

description: A good place for a creative twist on soft serve. I have tried both the honey and chocolate flavors. Honey was by far my favorite. The Honey Cream is similar to soft service ice cream, however it is much much creamier. Quick friendly service
author: Andrew N.

description:
It's like a slightly less sweet McDonalds soft serve. With Costco honey drizzled on top. For $4. 
PASS.
author: Christine Y.

description:
Don't be fooled -- that tiny little cup WILL kick your @ss. I was all, "What is this, a kiddie-size portion?? I'm gonna kill this thing in like 5 seconds."  20 minutes later, I was STUFFED and the cup was still like half full. It's much, much richer than it looks. 

The flavor was milky, creamy, and not too sugary. It's basically soft serve made of lightly sweetened heavy cream. I ordered the honeycomb version and thought the little hunk of honeycomb could've been bigger. I was done with that part in like 4 bites. 

Service was cheery and quick. The great thing about soft serve is they can cycle through orders quickly so even if there's a long line, you'll get served in a matter of minutes. 

It was good, but next time I go I'll work up a bit of an appetite first and see if there's another topping option that'll go further than that itty bitty piece of honeycomb.
author: SfMom O.

description: Umm.....yeah that basically how I feel about the ice cream.  I ordered ice cream with honey, it taste like plastic, I can tell they are using cheap low quality honey, ice cream itself is tasteless, no flavor.  I would say McD is taste way better than them.  Overall nothing special
author: Beth G.

description:
Ice cream, what? The cups look so cute. Lol Anyways I walked into this place and the two gentlemen greeted me. I asked for recommendations and they suggested "dark chocolate, cereal, or the honey comb". I chose the dark chocolate because I was craving something really really sweet. 

The gentlemen behind the counter made my "dark chocolate" and recommend a tad of sea salt on top, which made it really bomb as f**k. Haha. 

Their customer service is so great. Parking can be a problem, but it is worth coming to this place. 

The cup may be cute and small, but don't let the size fool you because I had my boyfriend help me finish my ice cream because it was so much.
author: Anriella D.

description:
The fact that I don't have to go to a fast food joint anymore to get soft serve ice cream.. I'm in love!

In fact, I don't think I've ever been to a place that specializes in soft serve ice cream. I went in not even knowing what I was buying actually, I just saw a bunch of pictures of it in Instagram and snapchat. When you walk in there are big words that say "organic soft serve ice cream" and that's when I was sold. They have a giant menu on the wall as well as laminated paper menus to look at for the people with not such good vision. The service I received was very inviting and you could tell the people working were VERY interested to see how people react to their hand crafted desserts, smiles all around! 

I'll definitely be back to try different items on the menu, mainly the cotton candy one. But I went with the honey one to play it safe and boy was I in for a good time. It wasn't too sweet which is what I was afraid of but I mean come on, who's goes to get soft serve ice cream expecting it to be light sweet?

On the other hand don't be fooled by the pictures, the portions are pretty small. But like I said this is handcrafted organic soft serve ice cream. I expect them to have larger sizes in the future as well as a way to pay besides cash. But for now, DONT FORGET TO BRING CASH.
author: Antonio J.

description:
This little place is such a gem. The inner sunset was lacking good organic ice cream! Tried this place in Taiwan before so I was so excited to hear that this one opened up in SF. 

My favorite here is the cotton candy affagato. Great blend of sweet , bitter, and fluffiness. Can't wait to see if they add some more flavors into the mix. 

I highly recommend a stop in for a refresher! Sweet but not overly sugary! Just right for full filling a sweet tooth. :)
author: Linda W.
