description: Simple menu, simple flavors done right. Not sweet by itself, the honey adds just enough to the soft serve. It tastes like cold milk, not tart like yogurt. I really liked the milk tea flavor with the honeycomb (sourced locally).
author: Lora A.

description: Tried this new place, not great. They only have vanilla.  It's the consistency of soft serve yogurt but has no flavor. I suppose you are supposed to get a topping or something. Seems like it's designed more  like a quickly than an ice cream place. Walk an extra block to the San Francisco Hometown Creamery for some good ice cream.
author: Steven B.

description: Deeeelicious! Best soft serve I've had compared to Milkcow, I ordered the popular honeycomb and the honeycomb pairs well with the original soft serve. They make the soft serve themselves, the same ingredients as they do at their overseas' stores. The environment felt so welcoming, with great customer service! Cash only for right now, but they will accept card soon (:
author: Suki L.

description: I loved this placeHoney soft serve ice creamit was so good and not too sweet if compare to honeymee and milkcow. This one is perfect for our tastes!!!
author: Khloe M.

description: The ice cream here is yummy and while I tried to get a pic of the honey comb my phone battery died. I also accidentally left it on the bench around 3:10pm-3:30PM on 5/21/17. If you found it, please charge and turn on and friends will try to call or reply to this post. The phone has a pink case with a popsocket on it. Please and Thank You!
author: Amanda L.

description: Cute little ice cream shop! Very limited flavor choices, but I got the cotton candy with milk ice cream and it was delicious (and super fun to eat).
author: Emily A.

description:
This is a recently opened soft served ice cream parlor.

There is only one type of soft serve flavor but you choose the type of toppings you want. The general price per item is $4.50 for a cup that is bigger than that of bi-rite ice cream. For the uniqueness of the concept and the fresh ingredients on top of the high quality ice, cream, it is a really good place to go to for a snack on a sunny day or dessert after dinner.

The soft serve ice cream itself is probably one of the best ones I've had and I think is well worth it. You cannot compare it to that of McDonald's or Costco soft serves. It's not too sweet and is light and creamy.

For the toppings I tried honey comb (their trademark), mixed grain, and chocolate. I highly recommend all of them.
author: Stanley C.

description: Came to Honey Creme with my girlfriend. The place is pretty clean and has a relaxing atmosphere. There is a bench by the window to sit. The gf and I shared a soft serve ice cream with honey and a mango slush. I usually don't care about ice cream but it was surprisingly good not too sweet and went well with the honey which tasted like local honey. As for the mango slush, it tasted like fresh mangos and the sweetness and ice was just right. So if your an individual that doesn't like things too sweet, I would recommend this place for dessert or a hot day.
author: John C.

description:
Inner Sunset isn't short of good ice cream and a big variety of them: if you aren't in the mood for gelato or frozen yogurt, you can always go to a grocery store and pick up some yummy Three Twins.  How would Honey Crème bring something different and special? I was a little dubious.  

But then again, I have never had honey comb mixed with creamy soft serve before either.  The simplicity is beautiful: the right amount of sweet and creaminess, no other flavors getting in the way.

$4.5 seems reasonable to me. Blue Bottle Cold Brew is $4 and I just paid $5.5 for a boba drink so let's not dwell on prices from a decade ago anymore.
author: Candice B.

description: I got the honey comb, it tasted like wax! The soft serve was good, I just need to eat it right away and try another flavor next time
author: Karen T.

description: Simple menu with quality ingredients. The base is the soft serve and you can pick from a small selection of toppings  (cotton candy, kettle corn). The soft serve is frothy and not excessively sweet. My favorite is the affogato (for the espresso lovers out there) that reminds me of a Frappuccino except on a soft serve.
author: Conely C.

description:
Both stars are purely for the service. The guy working here was extremely nice and we got our order quickly.

However, the soft serve itself was subpar compared to other similar places I've gone to. It wasn't very creamy/milky and after eating it, both my friend and I didn't feel that post-ice cream satisfaction. We had gotten the new combo that has the cereal topping, and the cereal bits tasted a bit stale. All in all, we didn't feel like it was worth it for the price (~$4-5 each).

TL;DR: Would not recommend and probably won't be coming back unless nothing else is open.
author: Natalie C.

description: Probably some of the softest ice cream I've next to frozen yogurt. I got the Chocolate Bacon with regular ice cream with extra chocolate. The ice cream was nice and soft. Chocolate was rich. The bacon and extra bacon were cooked pretty well and not burnt. I would definitely like to see them add more cream flavors in order to spice up the selection. Might also be great to have different sizes available.
author: John M.

description:
Came here after dinner. Wanted something sweet but also some coffee. For those coffee lovers out there, must try Affogato.  It was so creamy and sweet. Lots of coffee flavor. They use real expresso shot for this! So bomb!

Will be returning again :) yummmmmm
author: Crystal Z.

description: i legit.. woke up the next morning craving the "matcha" plus honeycomb ice cream. honestly heaven. the matcha actually taste like matcha!!!! most places sugar down matcha.... which truly takes away from the original flavor. the honeycomb was AMAZING. a little at a time... so rich, sweet, and tasteful. my best friend introduced me to this cute little shop, absolutely no regrets.
author: Juliet Q.

description: Was okay - I liked HoneyMee better. I ordered the classic ice cream with a honey comb. The soft serve had a weird, artificial-esque aftertaste, but I couldn't quite put my finger on what exactly it was. The honey comb was tiny and the bits got all uncomfortably stuck in my teeth. Also I think this place is pretty overpriced but I'm glad I tried it. If you want dessert, there are plenty of better ice cream options in the city. 3 stars for presentation and the very nice servers.
author: Wendy C.

description: The portion is totally worth the value. Their ice cream tastes soft and not too sweet, perfect for my taste buds. I tried the honey one and the drizzle of the sweet honey in combination with the creamy ice cream was perfect. Service was quick and they do a good job placing the soft serve ice cream into the cup and decorating it perfectly so that it's camera-ready! I will definitely try one of the exciting and unique flavors next time!
author: Tina R.

description: Very small spot with a bench along the window. The staff takes their time so you're not served a hot mess. I got the original soft serve in a cup with honey drizzle. While it was good, I wouldn't say I was blown away. However, that doesn't deter me from stopping in again to try a different flavor. I mean, what kind of monster would I be to not give soft serve a second chance?
author: Selena L.

description: Had to come try honey creme since they've made it here to sf. Theyre originally from Singapore, and that's probably why the hype for their soft serve is so crazy. I think it's pretty expensive for the quality & portion (8oz cup) - $4.50 for a soft serve with drizzled honey. Wouldn't go out of my way to get this - don't think I'll be back, good customer service though.
author: Angela L.

description: Tasted a lot like a McDonalds sundae but cost a lot more. I was happy to let my wife finish it.
author: Penny S.

description: This is for all the haters out there. This place was super yummy! Soft serve is smooth and creamy and not overly sweet. I got the pop corn topping and thought it was delicious! I will definitely be back to try other flavors! Staff was very friendly and helpful and service was quick!
author: Anise N.

description:
I love honeycreme! But I do think their honey quality could be better. I've went to a sister store or competitor in socal called Honeymee and their honey is much richer. Base soft serve is the same across the board.

My favs are the original and honey drizzle. I think all honeycombs are too waxy when served with ice cream. Caramel corn kind of becomes soggy but it was still pretty good. Cotton candy is really for the kids but whatevs dude. Affogato is gr8.
author: Becca W.

description:
Did it for the ig picture lol

Upon entering the cashier greeted us and gave us menus. The soft serve was around $5-6 depending on what toppings you wanted. I got the cone with the honey comb and it wa just alright, nothing special. The honey comb was full of honey, but I didn't like the fact that i had to spit out the wax every other bite. 

One of the workers saw that my honey comb was falling and rushed over to offer me another spoon to hold it in place. Very attentive and accommodating! 

Good service, but the price may be a little high on what you are offering.
author: Helen C.

description: I had the affogato with the cotton candy on top. The coffee pairs quite well with the soft serve- I liked that it wasn't overly sweet. I definitely could have just ordered without the cotton candy - I feel like I was just chowing down on the cotton candy to get to the ice cream and not actually enjoying it.Cute, new dessert concept but It's quite pricey at nearly $5 a cup. It is soft serve after all...
author: Jennifer W.

description: The moment we walked into this beautiful store, a friendly employee greeted us with hellos and told us about their signatures in the store. The tasty ice cream really was an escape from all of reality. I would really like to commemorate the employee for doing such a great job. Although and order was made incorrect for one of my friends, the employee ensured that she was satisfied. In addition to that, she helped us take a group photo,which I really appreciate. I would come here again! Thank you for a wonderful experience.
author: Bernice L.

description: I was craving something sweet and decided to give Honey Creme a try! It is a small location on Irving street with one employee working. It was a slow day so we got helped right away. Decided to get the affogato and the honeycomb. The soft serve itself was just okay. Not sweet which wasn't what I was looking for. The affogato was pretty good but the honey comb I couldn't even finish. This is a kind of place that I was glad to try it out but probably will not return.
author: Michelle T.

description: I'm confounded by this place. On the one hand, it's nice to have a light dessert, but on the other, it basically has no taste without toppings! Definitely not your American-style soft serve. Lacking flavor sans-toppings, it was difficult to get through even one serving between two people. Blah. Going to stick with ice cream or fro yo (so many options in the area!) next time. ;)
author: Shendi X.

description: Meh. I honestly wouldn't come back to this place. There really isn't any variety, and the soft serve tastes exactly like Strauss'. I opted to get mine topped with cotton candy because I love cotton candy. It was honey flavored, which was novel to me, but they ruined it by putting so much salt on it. :( My cotton candy also blew away in the wind, but that was probably my fault for not holding onto it. Be sure not to copy my mistake! ;)
author: Rachel H.

description: Whenever I'm craving caramel popcorn I'll for sure come here. The first time I came here, my boyfriend ordered the honey comb and I ordered the caramel popcorn. He pretty much devoured his and then mine -___- The second time I came here (without him lol) I ordered half chocolate bean and have caramel popcorn because I couldn't decide. Customer service was great, always ready to answer any questions or give you suggestions.
author: Jasmine Z.

description: Glorified soft serve. It was just okay and quite pricey for what you get. Albeit does taste better than regular soft serve bc it is "premium". You can taste the difference. It's smoother BUT I highly doubt I would come again and spend $4 per cup.
author: Dina V.

description: Great quality soft serve with some really fun, funky, and tasty toppings like cotton candy, chirps, and popcorn. Only drawback is that it is pretty pricey for what turns out to be a very small quantity of actual soft serve. Otherwise I would highly recommend!
author: Monica M.

description: We ordered the organic cotton candy and honey comb soft ice cream. The soft serve ice cream was delicious. It is kind of pricey considering the portion it came in; smaller than a tall cup from Starbucks. The cotton candy was salty but it contrasted well with the fresh soft ice-cream. I would be back to try the other flavors.
author: Curry S.

description: Not bad!!! It's not a dessert I would get often but once in a while cause I feel like there's other things better but for a quick go go dessert, this place is pretty good. I got the popcorn one and I really liked it, they gave decent amount of popcorn which was nice since I feel places like this tend to be a little stingy on the toppings. Customer service was pretty good too! Would come again!
author: Hiusan W.

description: Went in on a evening last week to avoid the crowds during usual business hours. New ice cream place on the block means everyone's going to be there fog or shine. I ordered the honey soft serve and the customer service is good. I got my order fast and the ice cream is delectable. Definitely will try the other flavors but hands down the classic honeycomb or honey is the way to go if you are a first timer. The soft serve consistency is spot on and the light sweetness of honey blends right in to the vanilla. I had expected the honey to harden in texture a bit because of clashing with the cold soft serve but the drizzle of honey was thin enough to avoid it. I'd definitely recommend this to any ice cream lovers out there wanting to try something different.
author: Serena C.

description: Honey Creme is one of my favorite ice cream places. The silky, creamy texture is decadent plus the addition of the honey comb makes it a premium novelty ice cream. 5 stars for deliciousness, but 4 stars for value. It costs approximately $5, which is equal to most boba dranks.
author: Alex Z.

description: There is no shortage of ice cream joints in the Inner Sunset but Honey Creme stands out in offering a good quality soft-serve.  What I love about it is that it is not overly sweet.  I had the dark chocolate topping, which hardened on the top, adding just enough sweetness.  Staff were nice and efficient.
author: Renee C.

description: Its such a cute place and their ice cream tastes really good!
author: Luna S.

description: Very delicious, light soft ice cream. Not too sugary which I like. I got the honey which tasted like raw honey straight from the honeycomb, it fit perfectly with the soft ice cream. Also got Mango slush. All their slushes are made with real fruits which is not very common these days in this area. Best mango slush I've had in a long time. The fruits to ice ratio was just right.
author: Kattie P.

description: I would give my overall experience here a 3.5 star. I got the honeycomb one and my friend got the plain one. We both didn't enjoy it as much. For honeycomb it was a bit too sweet because of the disproportional amount of honey to ice cream. The ice cream also tasted very moussey and plain.. The ice cream tasted very similar to McDonald's self serve and it's very different from the honeymee in SoCal!
author: Anna X.

description: Popcorn flavor reminds me of eating a caramel drumstick ice cream. Place looks clean, wish it was bigger with seating but then again it's just added expensive to the consumer so oh well.
author: Yale D.

description: We got the matcha honeycomb soft serve. It doesn't have enough sweetness or match a flavor  and tastes too creamy for a softserve. We literally threw out majority of the ice cream, which made us sad.
author: Linda L.

description: The ice cream doesn't have a lot of flavor. There's a hint of vanilla in it that isn't too strong. You do need the toppings for there to be some kind of taste. I tried the honey comb one and I didn't like it since there wasn't really any taste or sweetness.  I went again and I tried the dark chocolate. It was better than the honey comb imo. the portions are ok I guess?? It felt like a lot to me since I ate before I went here but if you're only getting dessert and haven't eaten then it probably wouldn't be enough
author: Annie L.

description:
Finally tried this place since they've opened. This place is pretty simple and bare, I guess it's because they're new. Pros: the honey ice cream is not overly sweet, it's the right balance and it was yummy! They also have in hand menus where you can read instead of squinting your eyes at the upper menu. 
Cons: cash only! At least for now they said. Needs to have more seating and tables perhaps? Portion is small.
author: Amy T.

description: Their honeycomb Ice cream is really sweet and milky, the shop is quite small and the portion is a little smaller than appears, but still good!
author: Ken H.

description: Great dessert, just wish there was a higher ratio of popcorn to ice cream (I love the texture and crunch)! Quick service, clean store.
author: Erica D.

description:
ehhhh. Was so excited to try it the first time and was like its gotta be a 10.. What was the hype about? They use Horizon Milk and powder and topped it off with alot of Honey. 

I wasn't too fond of it and my kid and teenager loves desserts but wasn't too fond of it either and was in fact gross off how much Honey they use. Not jsut that but why isn't the ice cream as good as they should be to a teenager and kids taste buds?

Was ok but nothing to really ramble about.. Went one and never returning. No biggy. I rather go to my local Whole Foods-isle and pick up an organic honey ice cream. 

I honestly can say I have had better..Nothing to rave about.. ehhhh

Otherwise the colorful cones are cute and the honey comb display is ok. good luck..
author: Kamaela M.

description: Really smooth soft serve.  The prices were a bit steep, most of them close to $5 for a small cup.  The honey comb that I got to top off my soft serve was unique, but I definitely wished I got the regular honey because the beeswax in the honeycomb was very chewy.  They also charge extra if you want a little bit more honey!
author: Kay A.

description:
In a world where everything is over sweetened with massive amounts of sugar, this is a god send! I love that the soft serve is not too sweet at all and super rich and creamy! I love that it's simply sweetened with honey and that the menu options are simple. It really just cuts to the chase. 
It's like a cold, soft, fluffy marshmallow that isn't sugar laden.  One bite can bring you back to simpler times. Maybe kids these days overindulge in such extremely sweet concoctions that when something isn't as sweet, it's just not good enough. Maybe my taste buds have evolved over time with age and I'm better able to discern and appreciate the finer subtleties of life.  Perhaps it's just Creme and Honey, what were you really expecting? 
This really hit the spot: not too sweet, cold, creamy, rich and oh just right! I felt like Goldilocks as she tried the perfect porridge.  
Note: it's pretty expensive for soft serve ice cream ($4.75?) but it was worth the experience!
author: Tu L.

description:
The ice cream is really good. My fave is just with honey. It mixes really well.

9th and Irving though...
author: John R.

description: Delicious vanilla soft serve with a selection of interesting and yummy toppings, like organic cotton candy and caramel popcorn.
author: M M.

description: There's a lot of critical reviews here, but I liked it. It had the right amount of sweetness and the small cup is a perfect portion size.
author: Julia C.

description:
In short: place is aiitte.

I was a little excited about this place when I noticed it across the street, so I had to try it. I guess I fell for their marketing. Stupid buzzwords like "premium" and "hand crafted" got to my inner sucker and after eating it, I felt pretty apathetic about it.

It's really just soft serve. Expensive soft serve where they could have given out bigger cups, or at least fill the cup up instead of just keeping it hollow in the already small cup. Very underwhelming once you get it and realize that you just spent $4-$5 on something that McDonald's sells for cheap. Value to price ratio needs some improving.

As for the "premium"? I guess they use real honeycomb as a topping if you want to call that "premium". I guess. And I guess "hand crafted" is technically correct, since someone is using their hand to put on some miniscule topping. I guess.

Maybe this is one of those 'fool me once' places. I don't see myself rushing back any time soon. It's like...good enough to eat again, but not good enough to go back..you know?

you knowwwww
author: mark t.

description: the ice cream is very good. We ordered the honey one. It is just perfect together. Tasty and healthy !!! I will become a regular ..
author: SumVivian S.

description: I had the popcorn one. At first it was nice but after like eating half, I got tired of it. Share one with a friend instead. Saves you guys money, for the cost of it. Great for a first time, but the ice cream isn't that big of a deal to come frequently.
author: Liseth M.

description: Small servings, but just enough. Perfect location next to manna where I pre gamed before dinner. The honey tasted so good and the frozen yogurt was so smooth and milky.
author: Fernilla S.

description: Everything mediocre, except the price. If you want to pay $5.00 + tax for something you can make at home on a 1/2 working brain, come here. The wait, the wait for a single order was seven minutes.  What was she doing, milking the cow!
author: Suzanne H.

description: Cute little soft serve shop in San Francisco. Decor was very plain and simple, and the presentation for the dessert is definitely there. The employees were very welcoming and friendly. I ordered the honey soft serve and actually enjoyed  it despite their Yelp reviews. The texture of the ice cream was reaaaallly smooth and creamy. I suggest ordering the honey or dark chocolate because the cream itself is pretty plain, so the toppings add a little more flavor to it. I'll stop by again next time I'm in town to try their affogato, which is an expresso topping.
author: Jamie N.

description: I was so excited to try this place but was so disappointed! Nothing special at all especially for the price.
author: G O.

description:
+/- THE FOOD
Definitely a fun dessert but not that great. I decided to be bold and try the cotton candy affogato and it was just okay. They first swirl the soft service with the espresso and then attach a small piece of cotton candy on top. Then, they pour a small shot of espresso on top of the cotton candy to melt it (not sure why, it didn't taste like anything). Finally, they top the soft serve with a huge piece of cotton candy. The cotton candy was fun to eat but it didn't really incorporate well with the soft serve since you can't really eat it together. The soft serve was actually quite bland and even with the coffee, it didn't taste like anything! It wasn't sweet at all, which made it a bit boring to eat, after you finished all the cotton candy. I did try a bit of the honey ice cream, which was better since it had more flavor to it. This place is also a bit expensive ($5ish) so I wouldn't really come back often, and even if I did, I would only get the honey ice cream.
author: Cindy C.

description: Don't expect anything more than simply delicious, not too sweet, creamy soft serve ice cream. It's way better than McDonalds (who thinks that's good??), and it's not Cold Stone, so don't expect your ice cream to be laden with stuff. The consistency was smooth almost like custard, the chocolate topping was very good. Yeah, it's a little expensive, but for a special dessert, it was worth it. Friendly service, didn't have to wait too long on a Saturday afternoon. Parking isn't easy, so prepare to enjoy a nice stroll in the Sunset unless you have the blessing of the parking goddesses.
author: Yankee S.

description: I got the cotton candy affogato ice cream. I love how dense and smooth the ice cream taste and how cool it is when they are making it. I will come back again to try the honeycomb flavor.
author: Coco P.

description: The ice cream here is delicious.  It's a favorite in Korea so worth trying.  Love honeycomb in my ice cream.
author: Ernest S.

description: Had the soft serve with honeycomb. The ice cream was nice, soft and flavorful. A slightly different flavor than typical but not a bad thing. The honeycomb in my cup was tiny, even compared to the tiny cup itself. It cost me $4.75. I know SF is pricey but wow I can't rationalize that amount. It was nice trying it but I would not willingly come back at that price.
author: Danny Y.

description: Meh. I was disappointed with the ice cream. It doesn't have much flavor and does not live up to hype. The affogato was good but didn't make up for the lack of flavor of the ice cream. Definitely costs more than it is worth.
author: Sarah K.

description: Simple menu, but delicious products. Currently eating the Affogato soft serve. I've been here twice so far and I love the thick, creamy consistency. I also appreciate that the soft serve isn't too sweet, since most desserts become overwhelming after only a few bites. From the products I've tried so far, this isn't the case. Glad this place exists, will be coming back soon.
author: Kelli K.

description: I surprisingly really like this place. I've tried their honey comb, popcorn, and afagato. I'd say afagato is my favorite so far. Their soft serve isn't too sweet, so the toppings they put on it gives it a nice balance. Staff is also super friendly! Great place for dessert.
author: Lina C.

description: My whole family really enjoyed this place exactly for the same reason some reviewers don't like it! Honestly think they opened this in the wrong city though. We looked online to see if they had other locations and were not at all surprised to discover they are a chain from Asia. Their flavor is light- not too sweet. If you are used to regular American ice cream and desserts- and enjoy the sweetness of it, you will think this doesn't have taste. But for those who are more reserved in their intake of sugar, this hits the spot!
author: Jai L.

description: Very tasty soft serve ice cream, the honey comb is tasty and sweet.  It goes well with the creamy texture and the not so sweet of the soft serve ice cream.
author: Stevezee C.

description:
Before I begin my review, here's a little background information about Honey Creme:

Honey Creme is a company with many locations throughout Asia and is owned jointly by Taiwanese and Korean companies. This SF location is their first in the U.S. They are known for using fresh, organic ingredients that are found locally, and for garnishing their soft serve ice cream with real honey combs harvested from bee farms.

Now onto my review:

I came here the day Honey Creme opened and the timing was impeccable. SF had unusually warm weather that day, making me crave ice cream like a fat kid who loves ... well, ice cream! I, myself, am not a big fan of ice cream, but looking through the photos that IG users have posted worldwide, it had really excited to try it out!

Got there in the afternoon and totally bypassed any line they probably had in the morning time. The staff were friendly, energetic, and eager to take your order. Looking at the menu, though, I was a little disappointed. It's still somewhat limited, and the selections are fixed in portion size and no customization of toppings are allowed. They also didn't offer some of the items I saw online, like the Yuanyang Milk Tea with Boba - ( http://www.honeycreme-icecream.com/img/our_flavors/introduction/Yuanyang_Milk_Tea_With_Boba_Cup.jpg ) or their Churros - ( http://www.honeycreme-icecream.com/img/our_flavors/introduction/Churros_Cup.jpg ).

I chose to just get a cup of their original ice cream ($3.75) to share with my friend. The cup was small, maybe too much so for many, but was the perfect size for me and my friend. To my surprise, it was good! Refreshing, airy, and not cloyingly sweet. But I also felt like I could get this kind of ice cream at many places in the city. And since I was sharing it with my friend, we asked if we could also get an extra empty cup to split the ice cream with, but they only allowed us to get two spoons. Maybe they're on a budget because the cute logos printed on the cups cost a lot?? But I honestly didn't mind because they were generous that day and gave away coupons for a free ice cream. How nice! The interior of the shop was also sweltering, and the only seating was a bench beside the window with no more sitting room, so we had no choice but to go outside to eat the ice cream. TIP: Eat fast, cause it melts fast!!

I'm glad a shop like this has opened in the area, but right now, it's just a little too gimmicky and feels like a passing fad. Once the IG users have taken their photos with the shiny, golden honey combs on their soft serve, the competition will be too fierce if Honey Creme doesn't offer a wider selection or offer customization options. In the meantime, I will go back to use my free ice cream coupon. ;)
author: Enari L.

description: I was excited that they opened one in San Francisco, so I finally got to try the honey comb one. I think it is pretty pricy for a small cup of soft serve, and it really doesn't taste anything special. They also don't have any seatings inside. The ice cream itself is decent, but it's not worth the price. I would not come back again.
author: Maylene F.

description: Reminds me of soft serve at McDs but jazzed up with honey and other fancier toppings. Prices are a bit high for the portion size but I guess it's like getting a fancy drink at Starbucks. At least you get your dairy intake for the day with the soft serve. Get a stamp card if you plan on coming often.
author: W A.

description: lovely cute and quaint. got the caramel corn topping and it was wonderful. their caramel is very good. the serving was a great size too. it's a very simple place. worth a visit.
author: Elizabeth H.

description:
Even though I just paid near $5 for a cup of soft serve vanilla ice cream and a piece of honeycomb yesterday, I still am giving a 5 star review.

At first, when I received the cup, my honest first thought was "I can't believe I just paid $5 for vanilla soft serve that I couldve gotten at McDonalds for less than half minus the honeycomb". My thoughts changed pretty quick as I devoured the first few bites.

Despite the reviews saying that the soft serve tastes like something you could get at McDonalds, I found it to taste much smoother and tastier than anything I could get at McDonalds. The honeycomb really does make a difference when you eat it together with the ice cream, it really was a delicious pairing! Granted $5 is steep for a small cup of soft serve and a piece of honeycomb, I'd say it's definitely something you should try. Heck, I paid $5 for it yesterday and already feel like getting another one today!

Two people behind the counter, young guy and a young girl who I heard is the owner. Not much to say about the service as all they need to do is take your order and make it. The girl was extremely nice though!
author: R C.

description: Average ice cream, it was pretty to look at but the taste was nothing out of ordinary. At least I got to update my Instagram.
author: I Y.

description: Parking sucks out here, but it's Irving street so I get it. It was my first time here- just popped in with my friends. The flavors are different than what I'm used to at other ice cream shops. If you love chocolate/coffee/cotton candy flavors, then you'll be happy here. They do have a milk tea flavor, but it was too sweet for me. I stuck with the original milk flavor with honeycomb- it's really airy and light but after a while, it got too sweet. IMO there's too much ice cream in the cup for one person to eat, but the pricing is fair. I might come back and share a cup of ice cream
author: Ali C.

description: This place is so cute. I came in here for my first time. Honestly, everything on the menu looks bomb. The worker helped me pick out what I should get. I ended up getting affogatto which is basically espresso type of ice cream and it was so good. Definitely will be coming back to try out the  other flavors.
author: Ana C.

description: Just looking through the pictures it gave me a good feeling about this place. Unfourtanely, the taste was way different than I expected. I ordered the basic honey comb but was dissapointed by the plain taste and the last bit of honey on the bottom of the cup.
author: Melanie N.

description:
It's "OK" ice cream, nothing very awesome, especially when you're paying over $4 for a such a tiny cup.
Around here there are so many ice cream shops lately, I don't see myself coming back here, organic milk thing maybe cool, but not strong enough reasons to pick specifically this store among all other ice cream shops around here, plus there is "Ice cream Bar" on Carl/Cole.
author: Micky F.

description: The cup is definitely really small like some of the other reviews suggest, but their service here is amazing and there is a difference in their soft serve compared to other places. It's thicker and tastes more real and organic than most soft serve. It's a bit on the pricier side; my friend and I shared the Honeycomb option and it came out to be $4.50. I'd say share the dessert because even though it's pretty small, if you're coming after dinner, it seems really heavy due to the thickness of the ice cream and the toppings. All in all pretty good. I'm not sure if I'd come often, but if a friend wanted to go, I'd come with.
author: Chris V.

description: This place was highly disappointing. The flavor of the actual soft serve tasted chemical, I couldn't finish mine despite it being a hot day. I will not be coming back for this strange concoction.
author: Diana B.

description: It taste like regular ice cream... Nothing wrong with regular soft vanilla ice cream and nothing special for the price I paid. Meh.
author: ABC Z.

description:
Why pay so much money for something absolutely TASTELESS?

Honeycomb was cool though.
author: Folashade M.

description:
3.5/5 

There is no way of justifying the whopping $4.75 price tag... The ice cream was mediocre and like every other non self-serve ice cream/froyo shop, you're going to get a hollow center. The honey comb makes the ice cream 10x more interesting than it actually is and I guess creates an opportunity for an insta pic... But personally, I didn't really enjoy the honey comb.The waxy texture resembled old gum. The mixed grain ice cream was surprisingly good though. I forgot what the powder consist of, but it somehow added an interesting flavor (in a good way) to the ice cream.
author: Tiffany W.

description: Agree reminds me of a glorified McDonald's sundae.  Soft serve with a drizzle of honey didn't impress me.  Not sure what all the hype is about.
author: Zoe B.

description: Flavourless junk. Seriously my gf and I both threw ours out. I had the original honey cream and it has almost no flavor whatsoever. If you must go, get a lot of toppings because the base ice cream is awful.
author: Alex S.

description: Got the popcorn one and it was very good. The person really packed in a lot of popcorn and I really appreciate that. The workers there were very nice. But for $4.50 for just soft serve ice cream I think it's just too expensive. I would come back to try the honeycomb one though.
author: Celia Y.

description: I think this is the best fro-yo in San Francisco. Fatty, creamy, not too sweet. Perfection! Organic dairy to add another plus.
author: Michelle C.

description: Good but average regular soft serve ice cream. Considering the name of the place, I thought all the ice cream was made with honey or something creative, only to find out it's just regular tasting vanilla soft serve. I was disappointed.  You actually have to order one of the honey-related items on the menu to get this "honey creme", which I didn't know until after ordering my dark chocolate (because I'm a chocolate person) and by then had already spent $4 on a very small cup. Personally I will walk down the street to the San Francisco Hometown Creamery & get something unique, rich & creamy next time. 3 stars only because it's ice cream, period.
author: Emily S.

description: I've been meaning to try this place out for a while - it's sort of tucked away on a less busy part of Irving Street, near 10th Ave. The concept is fairly simple - milk flavored soft serve with a variety of toppings. Their name sake is honey (honey comb, or honey), but I ended up trying the special Cereal Milk ice cream. The soft serve appears bland at first, if you're expecting vanilla, but I sort of like it. It's not too sweet and therefore you don't feel like you're overloading on sugar when you eat it with the very sweet toppings (e.g. honey). That said, I didn't end up finishing my whole cup because at the bottom (where there's no topping) it didn't taste like anything. But in concept I like this place!
author: J L.

description:
This place uses the same white soft-serve "ice cream" (if you want to call it that) as a base for their "ice cream" offerings --  The only difference between their offerings are the toppings and mixed-in amendments - most of which appear to be made primarily of sugar. 

So - try a taste of the base "ice cream" before paying 4 to 6 dollars for an order with toppings. 

We ask for and tasted a sample.  

It is NOT ice cream.  Frankly don't know what it is but it has a distinct chemical after-taste.  We couldn't even finish the sample --  it was ghastly and went straight in the garbage bin. 

 They refer to many of their toppings as "organic".  The fake "ice cream" cannot possibly be "organic" --  actually it cannot possibly be ice cream.  Most of what you are paying for in their very small servings is the "ice cream".  Save you money for something that is and tastes real. 

We can't think of a single reason to pay 4 to 6 dollars for frozen chemical glop topped with a tiny bit of so called "organic" sugary substance. So although we live in this 'hood we won't return to "Honey Creme" 

Their offerings may LOOK "pretty" but in this case pretty is as pretty TASTES and and this stuff TASTES pretty gross.
author: Yelp E.

description: first of all, i've lived in the neighborhood for 22 years and the recent proliferation of chain stores and especially asian corporate businesses saddens me and detracts from what used to be the charm of the inner sunset.  that said, honey creme's corporate product is overpriced, unimaginative, and as dull as, well, vanilla.  since when is ice cream from a machine such a precious commodity?  $4.50 for a very little serving, either in plastic or on a really lousy cone.  find a local business to support.  this place doesn't deserve your money.
author: Alexandria B.

description: It was pretty good.  It was light and fluffy and great if you're lactose intolerant to a certain degree.
author: Lorey P.

description: A new ice cream place right on Irving! It's a cute small shop with some nice looking ice cream. The people were nice and the toppings they had are really different from other places. However, the soft serve ice cream was not what I expected. It was definitely different from other ice cream places. I thought it was going to taste like vanilla but it tasted like plain milk which was different from what I am usually used too. I got the ice cream with coffee bean while my friend got the one with dark chocolate. I didn't like the coffee bean one. It taste like the corn pop cereal BUT my friend's dark chocolate was really good. I will definitely get that next time or the honey one. I should give this another place a try and get a different topping. I shouldn't let my first visit stray away from this cute little place. I will still keep this review a 3 star, but my mind might change the next time I come here
author: Peter N.

description: Great place for a quick dessert! It doesn't take too long even with a line out the door. I love their ice cream, it's very creamy and smooth. It is not a big portion but I think for the price it's worth it. I just wish they have more than one flavor of ice cream.
author: tim y.

description: Sugary toppings on cheap soft serve ice cream that made our stomachs feel...ugh.  Much better options in the area for the money.
author: D S.

description: Too sweet and flavorless. I would recommend go to other ice cream stores in the neighborhood.
author: Nan Z.

description: some pics def make them look bigger than they appear but the cups are about palm size. the soft serve wasn't too sweet which was nice. tried the chocolate and honeycomb. i added the cotton candy on my chocolate and it wasn't as sweet as other cotton candy. since i got the cotton candy it took awhile for my order since they spun it right on the spot. so the chocolate is suppose to have two premium dark chocolates...one for the base and the crunch...i wasn't that fond of the base. wish they had the other flavors:  http://www.honeycreme-icecream.com/our_flavors_en.html like 【Rose Jam with Popping Cotton Candy】,【Yuanyang Milk Tea with Boba】and 【Tiramisu】
author: she q.

description: We stopped by to get the kids a treat.  It was ok.  The ice cream is tasty but nothing spectacular.  We got the chocolate syrup.  Again, it was ok.  Honey creme is really expensive for what you get - the soft serve was hollow inside the cup.  The cup is already small so you get even less than what you think.  I think we'll go to easy breezy for the size and selection next time. Or maybe get two pints of ice cream from the grocery store.
author: G. W.

description: I thought that this place was pretty good. I ended up going with the Chocolate Beans flavor and paid $4.50 for a pretty small cup of ice cream. It tasted great and that's not the reason I'm leaving a 4-star review. The portion size felt a bit small to me given how expensive this place is... The ice cream did taste great, as I mentioned, but you pay quite a lot for not very much.
author: David P.

description: Fun place with such a cute vibe! I got the popcorn covered soft serve. It was very good, but nothing too spectacular. Definitely wanted to try it, but from now on I'll be spending my $5 for ice cream down the street at one of the other shops.
author: Tony G.

description: I paid $5 for a cup of soft serve ice cream and a tiny piece of honeycomb on top.
author: Tim M.

description: I've been here several times.  The best was the first day it opened.  The texture was smooth, creamy, and lightly sweet.  That's was perfect.  It was so pure and tasted heavenly.  Why not 5 stars.  Recently the soft serve is inconsistent in taste. It was icy and sweeter tasting.  I think the price is also a bit high for a small cup of soft serve.  I will definitely come back.  I hope they will be able to make it more like the first day I had it, creamy and lightly sweeten.  Please do not add more sugar!  Don't make it like other soft serve.
author: Dee A.
